text: I havenâ€™t used it on the entire car cause I lazy but Iâ€™ve been using it for spot touch ups on these fine scratches and light stains and it works really great

It's just strange that it's at the car door handle area and not around the whole car. Can it be so specific that the 'wind cut' velocity is so great around the door handles and not at other areas of the car? hmmm

I assume the main body of the car is designed aerodynamically so wind glides through it but for door handles  it protrudes out so it will â€œcutâ€ the wind. And the recessed area probably creates a small whirlpool effect? I donâ€™t know the physics behind how wind travels so thatâ€™s just my assumption on how I believe causes these scratches hahaha
I'm driving a Honda Fit GR (2020). It's not exactly that aerodynamic. lol

Itâ€™s a very common problem but an easy fix so I donâ€™t think too much about it. You can try toothpaste for a more DIY approach! It seems to work just fine but I donâ€™t know if it may affect the paint condition in the long run so I ended up using a proper car wax to remove them.
Next time I'll use microfiber cloth and toothpaste to try remove the micro scratches.
Watson got sell the soft99 ah
Recently my car got alot dirt stains cannot wash

pretty sure it's nails from ppl who use the door  and if we carry bags on our body it brush against it. that's why fine scratches at the door handle area.even if you seldom open the door  you still use it once in a while.if it's caused by debris and fine particles  pretty sure front bumper would have gotten it badly instead of door handle.
That's the issue  too many scratches to be from ppl cos I don't ferry ppl that often to accumulate so much. Anyway  I'll just try the toothpaste 'fix' to see if it'll work the next round.
could have gotten those scratches from car wash too
it builds up over time.i seldom fetch ppl too. but i open it to put stuffs at backseat.starting to see scratches on mine too after 3yrs.

The car wash workers  I'm familiar with them  they don't have pouches. But the possibility of their nails scratching it when opening and closing is a possibility. Just that I wash at most once a fortnight if it's really dirty.

Honda paint is generally thinner so it is prone to scratches.

I'm using TitaniumSH coating. So the scratch should be on the coating or deep enough to go past the coating. Well  this was in my earlier post on the coating question. It's ok. I'll observe if it still appears when I use a different car protection coat next year.
